title: Iconic Sydney meals van retires after 16 years | 7NEWS
description: An iconic van operated by the Reverend Bill Crews Foundation has served its final meals to Sydney's homeless community after 16 years of service in Woolloomooloo. Since 2008, the van has travelled the equivalent of four and a half times around the world, serving over half a million hot meals to people doing it tough, with up to 150 people visiting each night. The foundation held a farewell celebration to mark the retirement of the vehicle that has become a symbol of community care and support for Sydney's vulnerable population. title: Neo-Nazi group disbands ahead of hate speech laws | 7NEWS
description: The National Socialist Network, an Australian neo-Nazi group responsible for a rally at state parliament, will disband before January 18. New federal hate speech laws coming into effect threaten members with up to 15 years imprisonment. The group's affiliate organisations, including White Australia, will also be disbanded. title: Victorian bushfires destroy hundreds of homes as Premier faces backlash | 7NEWS
description: Victoria's bushfire emergency warnings have been downgraded to watch and act status, though multiple fires continue burning across the state. More than 500 structures including 179 houses have been destroyed, and over 15,000 farm animals have perished. Premier Jacinta Allen faced angry locals in Alexandria who criticised her over CFA funding, forcing her to leave through back doors to avoid the crowd. title: Ukraine strikes, Trump lawsuit and Gaza crisis | 7NEWS
description: Four people have died and hundreds of thousands are without power following a second Russian drone and missile attack on Ukraine in four days, targeting energy facilities during subzero temperatures. The BBC is defending itself against Donald Trump's $10 billion US lawsuit over edited footage of a speech, arguing he cannot prove damages after being re-elected. Six children have died from extreme cold in Gaza, with UNICEF reporting over 100 child deaths since October's ceasefire, most related to ongoing Israeli military action. title: Iran executes protester as death toll reaches 2,000 | 7NEWS
description: Nearly 2,000 people have been killed in Iran as the regime violently suppresses anti-theocratic demonstrations, with security forces firing on protesters from rooftops in suburban streets. A 26-year-old protester arrested days ago faces imminent execution without legal representation or defence lawyer, raising fears of a wider campaign of state executions. The United States has cancelled meetings with Iranian officials while European allies, including the UK, have summoned Iran's ambassador in a coordinated diplomatic response condemning the violence. title: Sydney pursuits, Victoria bushfire devastation and Australia Day plans | 7NEWS
description: Multiple police pursuits occurred across Sydney's west overnight, resulting in the arrest of a 20-year-old man in Yagoona. Victoria has downgraded bushfire emergency warnings to watch and act status, with over 500 structures destroyed including 179 homes and more than 15,000 farm animals lost. Sydney Harbour will host Australia Day 2025 celebrations featuring a ferry race, military salute, Indigenous dawn reflection ceremony, and a concert tribute to Bondi Beach shooting victims.
